page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: In the Bernera area most mussel farmers use rafts of wood and polystyrene which can provide bouyancy for a harvest of 5_8 tonnes of mussels. Rafts are basically 7x7 m square and consist of two floating units connected by wooden beams (carrying the hanging mussel ropes) about 0.5 meters apart. Each 7m beam can support 14_15 mussel ropes and each raft supports a total of about 300 ropes. As long as the ropes are kept free of the bottom by hanging them from rafts the mussels escape being eaten by crabs and starfish. Mussels reach a marketable size of 5_8 cm in about 2 years.
